alert.note: Alert for Mecklenburg (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 2:28PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Mecklenburg County through 300 PM EDT... At 228 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Clarksville, or 13 miles north of Henderson, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Rain 1 to 2 inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Possible flooding of low lying areas. Locations impacted include... Boydton, Richardson, Keats, John H Kerr Dam, Eppes Fork, John H Kerr Reservoir and Palmer Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in Ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid mydroplaning. If you are on or near Kerr Reservoir, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike more than 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to a safe shelter. Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
